result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle L. PORODISH was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Morphine, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Deliver Morphine, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain full-time employment/schooling combination.  
Obtain HSED/GED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Speak to high schools on one occasion with their permission regarding the dangers of drugs.  

Visit the grave site of Nathan Farr on the date of his death.

timeConds.notes: on count 2 only, under the Huber Law, to commence immediately.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State files an Amended Information which adds counts 2 and 3, 2 counts deliver Morphine, contrary to Section 961.41(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST pleas entered to counts 2 and 3, two counts deliver Morphine.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report.
PSI is due to the court by 07-20-15.
Sentencing is set for 07-30-15 at 9:00 a.m.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample at this time and order that bail be revoked.
State to draft order revoking bail.

Minutes.
Re:  Nathan A. Farr, on 07-13-14.

Defendant in custody.
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 1st degree reckless homicide.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-26-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with Alysha Hammond, Nicholas Nowikowski or Robert Collins, defendant must report daily to the Manitowoc City Police Department by 3:00 p.m. and they may test for drugs and alcohol and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant remanded to the county jail, commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
